intro: Phaca dolichostachya, commonly known as the long-stalked phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its slender stems and small, inconspicuous flowers are adapted to attract pollinators like bees and flies. Phaca dolichostachya is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
